column4: how can I get an iso of Edubuntu? I'm on 56k dial up, and my connection times out every 8 hours? Download Manager won't resume where the connection broke. I'm running Dapper, ideas?
it may be easiest to order a CD from Canonical.
I tried that, and the shipit folk turned me down. I had no problem getting Edgy and Dapper disks, so it is a mystery why they refused to send me Edubuntu?
perhaps for institutions only.  the only difference is a few packages, which you can install onto either Edgy or Dapper.
roger, that, how can I promote it to the local schools, if I can't show it to them?
i see what you mean.  you can always build your own livecd's.
roger that to, have a good howto on that?
there are a few on the web.  there's one on the ubuntu site.  i'll do a search for you.
thank you.
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/LiveCDCustomization/6%2e06
thank you.
your welcome.  i hope it all goes well for you.
just a sec...
ok
~15 grams
with the sleeve, I'm playing with Dapper.
i'm sure that'll put it around a gram.
A GRAM!
about ...
your mixing up your variables, there are 27 grams in an ounce.
yeah.  you know.  :)
yes, I do, that's why I knew what was happening. :)
i hear ya.
bedtime, time for me to wake up!
